job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.
job_details.full_text:
Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern

Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on 'Intelligent Automation' and 'robotic engineering' using tools like UiPath, which are primarily for Robotic Process Automation (RPA) rather than core AI/ML model development or generative AI applications. While AI and Machine Learning are mentioned as tools for fixing robots, the core tasks revolve around monitoring, maintaining, and deploying existing automation solutions, aligning more with business process automation than the specialized roles of ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer. The role also emphasizes business understanding and stakeholder collaboration, and lacks deep technical AI/ML or GenAI development responsibilities.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure' and 'collaborate with business leaders' directly relates to understanding the business context and aligning technical solutions with business needs.
job_tasks.phrase: gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements' indicates interaction with business stakeholders to understand and define needs.
job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Draft Process Definition documents' implies a step in defining and documenting processes that are often precursors to data handling or automation setup, though it's a lighter form of data engineering.

The phrase 'Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)' indicates the application of AI, ML, and GenAI techniques to resolve issues within existing automation systems, which can be considered a form of model adaptation or application.
job_tasks.phrase: Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing...)' implies development or modification of code within the UiPath platform to resolve problems, which falls under software development in the context of automation tools.
job_tasks.phrase: Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations' suggests involvement in the development and deployment lifecycle of automation solutions, which is a form of software development.
The phrase 'Monitor robots on daily basis' is a direct responsibility for observing and ensuring the operational status of automated systems, a key aspect of operations engineering.
The phrase 'Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations' implies involvement in the deployment and maintenance of automation solutions, which aligns with operations engineering.

soft_skills.phrase: learn from the best Automation professionals out there!
